page.title: 19 CLIFTON - BUILDINGS
page.content: The {HOUSES} in Clifton are mainly built of stone. About half are older. Of the 30 or so modern houses, 20 are on estate called County View. There is a terrace of brick built houses. Most of the houses are big and nearly all are built along the main road. There is a {PUBLIC HOUSE} called the 'Duke of Northumberland's Head' Other interesting buildings are the old {WATERMILL} ,the {CHURCH} of St. James (now a jewellery factory) and the {CHAPEL} which is now redundant. One house of note is 'White Gables' which has gable ends extending to the ground.
